intro: Myrtoleucodendron urceolare, commonly known as the urn-shaped myrtle, is a rare and unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive urn-shaped flower clusters. The plant has leathery, lance-shaped leaves that are typically grayish-green in color. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
